docs.title: Refusal to Honor ATT Trade-In Offer
docs.text: sequence of events...september 2016 - bought all iphone 7 to qualify for offeroctober 2016 - new iphones arrived and turned in old iphones to a storenovember 2016 - credits start applying for 2/3 phones; reached out to wwireless trade-in team and received reply that all phones have been received; they said that credit should apply within 1 to 2 cycles.january 2017 - still no credits on 3rd phone; reached out to wwireless trade-in team again; they said no longer their problem and to go to customer care; 1st call goes to customer care who says that issue should be resolved within 48 hours after case filed; nothing happensearly february 2017 - 2nd phone call to customer care who apologizes and again says that issue should be resolved within 48 hours with new case filed; still nothing happensmid february 2017 - 3rd phone call to customer care who apologizes and "escalates" to manager who files urgent case again stating that outreach should happen within 48 hours; urgent case number received but no communication from the teamlate february 2017 - still no outreach from the team after another weekmy family has been with wwireless for years now and did not expect should terrible treatment. it should not be this difficult to get the credits especially after the customer care representatives admitted over the phone time and time again that it is wwireless's fault in terms of the system error. if you pride yourself on "customer care", you would not continue to deceive customers like this (yes, i've read through other similar cases).

docs.title: 4th Line Discount with Basic Phone
docs.text: switched all 4 of my lines to the new unlimited plan today. i have 4 iphones so my planshould cost$220 for the first 2 months.($60+$40+$40+$40+$40) however, when i go online it is showing up that it will cost$205. ($60+$40+$40+$25+$40). these are not from a bill, but rather the cost summary under the view plan and features tab.online on my account the phone that is showing a charge of $25 is showing up as an iphone 5s. however, up until a few months ago this phone was a basic phone until it broke. when it broke i swapped the sim card into an iphone 5s.i called today to try and correct this issue but the service rep was not able to see what i was talking about.my big concern is that i will not be receiving the $40 discount after 2 months as the plan states that the 4th smartphone is free...and i will be billed for 3 smartphones and 1 basic phone.anyone have any ideas what to do?update:fixed it this evening.i finally got my hands on the phone and the internet did not work at all, even though i was told it was on the unlimited plan. so i called customer service and the person i got knew right away what the issue was. the issue was that their system still showed the imei for the old basic phone she used to haveinstead of the iphone 5s she has now. they updated their system witht the correct imei and the plan to show it as a smarphone and boom internet works. also, the account online is now showing a correct price of $220!it took me a while to get her vissual voicemail set up, but once i remembered how to use the voicemail-of-the-nineties, where you have to dial in and enter your pascode, i was able to finish setting it up.

docs.title: Unlimited PLUS starts Thursday with 10GB TETHERING! Unlimited Choice is $30 cheaper. ATT stepped up!
docs.text: hey stepped up and prices look pretty good. more than enough to make many happy i'd think (not all of course).they're not lower than everyone else, but they're way more competetive than they were.i personally don't feel they need to be lower they don't need to match everyone else. they are their own company, but it's nice that they're not so far out of touch of the other major providers.plans come with roam north america feature.and 10gb of tethering / hotspot! they really should have made it a little more to compete, even 12gb, but it'll do...plus$25 discounts for wsatellite! including directv now (don'tget too excited, it excludes go big $35/mo. plan).autopay required for that pricing(excludes credit cards).while it says"plans may not be eligible for offers, credits, or discounts", which i assume means no fan discounts, it does say"qualified military & veterans will receive a 15% discount on their monthly service charge" which is$75 (for single line) or off $105 (for multi-line) for theunlimited plus plans.https://www.wwireless.com/shop/wireless/unlimited-plan.htmlthis is the public wwireless community forum (not wwireless support), please do not post personal info.when solved / helped, please click "accept solution" which helps other people to find an answer more quickly. just because my answer does not solve your issue (or agree with you), it may still be the correct information...the (very) fine print - this footer is at the bottom of all my posts, it's particulars may, or may not, apply to you & your post).solved!go to solution.

docs.title: Unknown alarm going off
docs.text: here is an alarm that sounds like the little tune that plays when the phone is turned on but longer, and it sounds at 8:30 pm, but not on saturdays. it just started recently, and i cannot find what has prompted it. any clues? thank you!

docs.title: Consumer fraud/ Identity theft?
docs.text: tried to get a iphone 6 plus almost a year ago now, after i paid 171.91 cents to pick it up in the store. i get all the way to the store and the guy tells me i have to give him 500$!!! i didn't even have 300$! ha! i asked that he cancel the order and service because it hasn't even been 24 hours and i didn't even get to see the phone! a week later i start getting bills in the mail. funny thing is, the bills weren't even in my name, just under my social and address  i've called multiple times and always either get transfered or hung up on. when i finally got through i'm told i have to pay 819$ for a phone i never touched and a service i never used. i've had this collection on my credit for a year, almost 1000$! i can't even get wsatellite now! i love direct tv! going to print out arbitration forms now.
